website_summaries.verdict: A basic shooting earmuff that offers budget-minded consumers quality at a value price.
pros: Boasts an easy-to-fold design and PVC ear pads for added comfort
Provides protective noise reduction at an unbeatable price
cons: The headband may not adjust enough to fit all wearers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!! I bought three pairs of these and ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect!! I bought three pairs of these and one of the ClearArmor 141001 Safety Ear Muffs 34dB, after reading the reviews I thought I needed the bigger and adjustable ones for me. Big mistake!! These ear muffs are EXACTLY, repeat EXACTLY same as the nearly twice as much clear armor!! They clearly came out of same press, absolutely perfectly identical!! They are adjustable, not sure why others say that. My head is large and fit fine, superb protection!! Don't buy more expensive pair, only difference is name on side of them.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the stated NRR
customer_reviews.text: These ear muffs claim to have an NRR of 34 dB. Yet the 3M Peltor X4A, which have a rating of 27, provide significantly better noise dampening in my testing. The Walker muffs especially fail at creating any kind of seal around the ears when wearing glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Joel B.

customer_reviews.title: Vise like grip
customer_reviews.text: Apparently nobody at Walker has an actual adult size head. These are tight. I could overlook the grip if the cups made it to the bottom of my ears. They don't. These are the most uncomfortable muffs I've ever worn. The only reason they're getting two stars is their NRR, they do a good job at blocking noise. My wife likes them, I hate them if you're an adult male that has a head that didn't stop growing when you were 7 look at this set of muffs  they don't fold but they're very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Danger

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Same as the ClearArmor muffs, just a couple of bucks cheaper with a different logo. Not the best thing on the market, but adequate, especially given the price. They do fit tight, but not so much that it bothers me. I prefer plugs if I'm not shooting next to others, and I wear these over plugs at ranges. For me, these do NOT cut it alone if I've got others shooting right next to me.
customer_reviews.author: jm2

customer_reviews.title: The one good point was it didn't seems to hurt to wear ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought I could use a range shooting muffler to drown out the TV of my hard of hearing husband that demands that I sit next to him. I put these things on and still heard MASH! The one good point was it didn't seems to hurt to wear them, but if you are using them for a gun range I would go somewhere else b/c Alan Alda beat these things out!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. Once I put on shooting glasses though I noticed a little sound coming through. However, wearing these with inner ear plugs works best for indoor shooting for me. I would buy them again, great value. These are in fact marked 30NRR for the national raiting, and 34 NRR for the OSHA rating which isn't the real rating. Go off the 30NRR for shooting and such.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but deficient in NRR
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the most comfortable pairs I've ever had, but I had to add foam in the cups to cut the sound to a quiet level. The shells are single-layer. Overall I would say these are somewhat average in NRR performance, better if you can tweak them with more (open cell) foam, but they are exceptionally comfortable and their profile isn't too thick.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: They work great.
customer_reviews.text: Very snug fit and great noise reduction. I was indoor with some 40 caliber pistols and never felt my ears were being overloaded at all. I could still hear people talking ( loudly) and a range instructor 2 bays away yet my ears were stress free when everything was booming. As a stereo nut ear protection is paramount and these are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: groover

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective at blocking noise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for when I am using the snow blower or lawn mower, or other power tools. The noise reduction is very impressive. The band does not appear to adjust, but these fit well and are comfortable. I tend to use them with wireless earphones, and they fit over those and a winter hat without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wood

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value Price Shooting Muffs
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are some of the best hearing muffs you can get for shooting your firearms. Good protection and fairly durable. Only reason I gave 4 and not 5 stars is because they do sort of "smush" your ears when using them for prolonged amounts of time. But hey, for the money their really good.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor G. Coley

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product with very good noise reduction that is a super value at the price point. However, the web page says the NRR is 34, and the packaging that I received said the NRR is 30. A NRR of 30 is pretty good, so its still a useful product, but its not right to advertise the NRR as 34, when that is not correct.
customer_reviews.author: Rover

customer_reviews.title: they will be great.
customer_reviews.text: These muffs do very well at blocking loud guns but do not work well at all if using on a rifle with a scope. They are too big and you can't get your cheak on the stock. If using for pistols, knock yourself out, they will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Deal!...I got 3 pairs!
customer_reviews.text: These work great! They're also SUPER comfy. Block out a great deal of sound (more than my last pair), and they're VERY affordable. Can't say enough good things. That said, I was told by my buddy that if you're gonna line up some cheek action on a long gun these might not be the best because they stick out quite a bit on the sides, and for that you'd probably need something with a little less of a profile, i.e. something with a much thinner "muff" lol! I said it! And it wasn't even inappropriate! Great "muffs" tho, for real...Haha! I said it again!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again for sure
customer_reviews.text: These muffs provide excellent protection. I always use both ear plugs and muffs at the firing range. This particular pair of muffs have u-shaped wires (as seen in the picture) which allow the muffs to be compacted down in size into my gun bag. These muffs grip well to my head -- not too tight, mind you: they don't squeeze so much as to cause a headache. The padding feels comfortable to me: not as soft as a $200 pair of stereo earphones, but rather with some ruggedness for the range. I have used my pair extensively, during many trips to the pistol range. They have served me well, and would recommend them to anyone wanting to protect their hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Gecko

customer_reviews.title: What? did you say some thing?
customer_reviews.text: nice ear protection for a nice price. i have some that are twice this price and i cant tell the difference. my only suggestion if you get head aches from wearing tight things like this on your head is get a small basket ball and let them rest on it for a few days or a week. it will take some unneeded pressure off you head. if you dont have a smaller basket ball try your coffee table or chair arm rest. just be careful not to stretch them out larger than a big head you dont wanna break them.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good sound cancelation, but tight compare to others.
customer_reviews.text: I believe the NRR 30 is really accurate as it is noticeably quieter than my 29 rated earmuff. However, the head clamp is considerably tighter than other earmuffs. It is ok for a short period activity like lawn mowing or a quick range session. But for hours long activities, I will not wear these because they are just too tight.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: MOST.DIFFICULT.PACKAGING.EVER.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously. Required bloody power tools to extract from the darned hermetically sealed melted on plastic display packaging. I recommend poultry shears or a band saw.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: Very Small
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7.25 hat size and these would not begin to let me put them on. The noise cancelation looks like it would be find if you have a small head so they fit. Amazon let me return them via free shipping so no problem there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good ear protection
customer_reviews.text: I use these over my ear plugs just because I like hearing and want to keep hearing when i'm older. They get the job done for passive noise cancelling. They're fairly comfortable. They're not super nice compared to higher end headsets, but they get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I bought. They cancel the noise, they fit comfortably, they look cool and they're less than $15. Take all that money you saved by buying these and spend it on more ammo.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use these the other day, outdoor shooting area, shooting 5.56 and 9mm. A guy 50ft to my left made me jump when he fired off his socom w/out my realizing it. These worked great. Slightly tight fitting but I have a big head. Compact. I used to use in-ear hearing protection and these are much easier to get instant fit and function. They fit well over my ball cap and shooting glasses.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: shooting muff
customer_reviews.text: WOW... these are GREAT. Light and has a comfortable grip over the ear. The DB loss is super and works well. Almost like being deaf with guns going off close by.
customer_reviews.author: Homer Zzyzzx

customer_reviews.title: A little snug, but worked great at the range
customer_reviews.text: These muffs fit a little snug, but you get used to them. They fold up nicely to fit in your range bag with minimal space being taken up. They were very comfortable, and cut out the noise at the range just as good as the expensive ones, if not maybe a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to get a more expensive headset that needed batteries, but pulled back on it and instead purchased this model instead. Used in an indoor firing range and quite with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R Florence

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy
customer_reviews.text: These ear muffs fit great and protected my ears from shooting a 12-gauge shotgun (Kel-Tec KSG) and .357 Sig (Glock 33) outdoors at the range. They do make your ears sweat a little but for me it’s worth it for the protection.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalie Lima

customer_reviews.title: Great Ear Muffs for Shooting
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Canadian, and generally owning or using guns in Canada is frowned upon - especially in the city. This past year I was placed in the US for work. I decided to take the opportunity while I was down there to try going to a range, and shooting a variety of rifles, shotguns and hand guns. I bought these Folding Muffs for my trips to the range. They're truly a great deal. They're comfortable. They are excellent at muffling sound in an indoor range. And they're cheap. What more can you ask for? If you're a casual shooter, and you simply want a functional pair of muffs, I wouldn't pass these up.
customer_reviews.author: Prairy Earth

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING product for an AMAZING price
customer_reviews.text: My son has autism and we needed a product for him to wear in public. We have paid more money for lesser products, but we were so happy with these, I ended up buying 2 other sets. I even let my son pick which headphones he wants to wear, and her always pick these. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Schoffstall

customer_reviews.title: great hearing protection
customer_reviews.text: Best noise reduction muffs on the market for the money! They adjust to fit from extra large to small heads and fit snug for great noise reduction 34db I have tried all brands and types these are the best I've found! They fold up and fit in a range bag. I shoot 10 mm, 40sw, 357 sig and 9 mm, great muffs for these hand guns! But I do recommend also using Pura Fit 6800 ear plugs with any muff. Which I have always done. I suffer from sensitive ears wiith tinnitus from shooting with out muffs when I was young and dumb and worked with chain saws and heavy equipment . Best buy In muffs, of all out there,
customer_reviews.author: POPB1949

customer_reviews.title: Compact, comfortable and they work great.
customer_reviews.text: Kills a ton of noise. At a range with 6+ other people shooting.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fearon

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic! My stepdaughter is autistic and has auditory aversions; we bought these so she could enjoy fireworks, loud movies at the theater and parties/gatherings with loud music. I tested them out before giving them to her and I was impressed. As an avid shooter, I would absolutely use these on the range. They're comfortable, quiet, and you can't beat the price. We keep them in the car at all times for my stepdaughter and have been able to enjoy so much more with her because she can block out any noise that is bothering her (like the bagpipes at the Highland games!).
customer_reviews.author: The Piper

customer_reviews.title: Great, with one considerable flaw
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Really quiet - Light weight - Comfortable padding - Very adjustable Cons: - They squeeze my head, eventually causing a headache. If you aren't planning to wear these for too long, or if you have small head, you should be fine. If you plan to wear these for extended periods of time, you may want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: MustachePanache

customer_reviews.title: Too much pressure on ears
customer_reviews.text: This earmuff works but is uncomfortable to wear. I'll continue to use my old set of earmuffs and lend this Walkers to anyone who wants to borrow it
customer_reviews.author: HQC.

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but effective
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these sets for my husband and I to use at the shooting range. They work very well and block sound as they are advertised to do. The units are somewhat bulky. They do not fit in my small range bag but can be hooked over the handle or transport to the range.
customer_reviews.author: Twila R.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use while using woodworking tools and to shoot with. They really are comfortable and reduce the noise much better than my previous ones from a different manufacturer. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Chief2756

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent set for the price. I bought 2 sets the second was for my wife. She liked them and said they were more comfortable around her ears than our old ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sting45

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy, great protection, great price.
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic for shooting range protection, especially considering the price. I tried them out in a packed range last night, shooting multiple handguns, and these muffled the shots much more than my previous pair of 22db muffs. I'm a woman and these fit perfectly and are very comfortable. If you have a huge head you might want to find another pair. No complaints, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good buy
customer_reviews.text: Gave me a headache after wearing for two hours at the range. I also wore foam ear plugs underneath the over ear protection. I used these recently at an outdoor range. I’m hoping I will get acclimated to the ear protection as they do perform well.
customer_reviews.author: Michele L.

customer_reviews.title: Good value, nice sound protection.
customer_reviews.text: great sound reduction, great price, they fold up nicely, but they are not very comfortable, I use my ear plugs more then I use these, I throw these on over the plugs if the ear plugs arent enough, generally when the range is packed. overall, its a good quality, slightly bulky, they do get in the way when aiming with rifle, that may just be a personal issue, they bump on the butt-stock.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Love them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the range and I love them.. Much better than using range provided ones that are all beat up. I shoot an XDM 3.8, which can be quite loud. This muffles the sound to an enjoyable level. While I can still hear someone talking next to me if they are really close (sometimes important) the noise from the gun is nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hennessee

customer_reviews.title: Same Exact as the 3E Model Lowes Sells
customer_reviews.text: This is the SAME EXACT model sold by Lowe's/Home Depot for roughly $17. So buying this brand will save you a few bucks. I'm holding them side by side as we speak and they are 100% identical.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for vacuuming my condo. Vacuum cleaners are loud and there's no sense in damaging your hearing for such an activity. Better to kill your hearing on sporting events, concerts, and other fun things. :) I did not receive any discounts, freebies, or other renumeration for my review. I am not an employee or affiliated with the manufacturer of this product in any way.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: They're the best headphones, now
customer_reviews.text: I use 34NRR earplugs and these headphones for teacher drum lessons up to 8 hours per day. They're the best headphones, now. A specialist told me that the earplugs are probably getting me a real 28db and the headphones are giving me an extra 4 or 5db of protection. Since db work on exponents, that's a lot of help. If I'd done this all along instead of just headphones for 4 years my ears wouldn't be whining at me right now. Riiiiinnnnnnngggggggggggg. Ooof.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Zeppelin Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: No offense to Stihl power equipment muffs, but these Walkers are head and shoulders better for muting blasts at the range. You can really tell a difference. I have an average size head and these do fit snug, but not overly tight as being uncomfortable to wear. I can't imagine buying any better quality for the price. I did purchase the case and leave these in my shooting bag so I never forget. Well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Go Dawgs

customer_reviews.title: One head-crushing size...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely head-crushing. I've tried heat and extended stretching and they felt great for a minute but after I put them away, they were back to their same shape. No possible way of adjusting to your head. I just have a basic sized head....so, the bigger your head, the more pain you will endure. But they do block out noise well. I just need to find something that is either adjustable or just not so head smashing.
customer_reviews.author: KimberLee

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy the head phones.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these to use when mowing and working on farm tractors. It has worked very well. I use a pair of earbuds under them to stream music from my phone and it muffles the other noise enough to allow me to listen to my music. It also helped to keep the ear buds from pulling out of my ears while turning my head regularly to see around the area I am working in. I use them for 2-5 hours at a time. I have found them to be very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: orgulio

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but tight
customer_reviews.text: Works great, shot a 12 ga outdoors all day no problem. They are quite tight though so if you haven’t big head might not be comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great simple muffs
customer_reviews.text: Great hearing protection! Im post artificial eardrum surgery (tympanoplasty) and take pride in proper hearing protection. Very quiet especially combined with disposable foam plugs. Indoor shooting range, with muffs and foam plugs, my Beretta 9mm sounds like my Ruger 10/22! I do with there was a gell surround instead of foam. Would increase the NR rating that much more and increase the comfort level. Overall I highly recommend these! Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for blocking out the sound at the indoor range.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these ear muffs to replace the skull crushing set had before. Fit great and still comfortable after wearing for two hours straight. They are perfect for the indoor range and block out the mega cannons that always seem to end up beside me.
customer_reviews.author: Rod S.

customer_reviews.title: Made in China and it shows.
customer_reviews.text: Made in China. Quality is on par with their bad, obnoxious television commercials. These are sold as adult muffs but aren’t big enough to properly fit the average American man. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: They squeeze your head pretty tightly. It hurt my head for a while ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a software engineer. I use these at work to help keep me focused. You can still hear the outside world when you have these on, but they are definitely a significant improvement over listening to the sales people who sit next to you talk on the phone all day. They squeeze your head pretty tightly. It hurt my head for a while when I first started wearing them (especially since I wear glasses). I suppose the squeeze is a good thing, since the tight seal helps keep sound out, and they don't fall off. But I had to stretch them out for a while before I could comfortably wear them for hours on end.
customer_reviews.author: Justin LaPolla

customer_reviews.title: Great for outside though
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight and adjustable. I did buy the extra protection plugs for indoor range as that is much louder that outdoor. When you have someone shooting a shotgun next to you indoors the muff itself is not really enough. Great for outside though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great....a little snug....but they need to be
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. It's a little tight and I can see where people in the other reviews might say that they feel a little uncomfortable. ..... however, I wouldn't say that I'm in pain.....its just gentle pressure. They block noise appropriately and my ears feel protected. There is no ringing in my ears when I leave the range. Would I purchase again.....Yes! But I doubt I will have to because they seem to be really well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Noel Lance

customer_reviews.title: Get some!
customer_reviews.text: No earplug can suppress the sound of gunfire like a good muff can, and these muffs are as good as any I've ever used! They're very comfortable, and they fold up super-small. I suffer from tinnitus after years of working near construction machinery -- and many happy weekends at the shooting range. Because of that, I'm careful with my hearing. I have complete confidence in these Walker muffs -- and the price was great!
customer_reviews.author: tbone0106

customer_reviews.title: Try another product, sound proof Quality isn't great, I heard every shot loud and clear, its just a protection for your ear!
customer_reviews.text: Took to the range today, not a big fan of this, sound proof isn't really great , 2 booth down, someone shooting, i heard it like it was right next to me, Try another product, its only a ear protection, not much on the sound proof area. I would recommend another product .
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Buy these if you value your hearing!
customer_reviews.text: I put these on when I'm using noisy appliances in the kitchen, like my blender, etc. And it works very well indeed. I am so pleased with how good it protects my hearing. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: agilosi

customer_reviews.title: May be the best purchase I ever made.  Just an outstanding product.
customer_reviews.text: I have had plugs or muffs all my life and that's been plenty believe me but never have I had a fair that is this noise damping. These are fantastic and I don't use that term lightly and if you take in the fact how inexpensive they are that word fantastic changes to outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: lcm1947

customer_reviews.title: Quiet For Real!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and quiet! A bit bulky but best I have used. At shooting range or around my home with chainsaw!
customer_reviews.author: Trickster

customer_reviews.title: The numbers tell the story!
customer_reviews.text: These muffs rated at 34db work great! The next best I could find were only 31db. Does not seem like a huge difference unless you know that each 3db = x2 factor in gain or loss. In other words, the 34db pair is twice as effective as the 31db pair. Additionally, the Walker miffed are comfortable and fold up to use minimal room in my shooting bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've used several over the years.  This is the best.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4 and many brands are too small. These are comfortable and good noise protection.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brazelton

customer_reviews.title: i find this muffs to be quite comfortable, not only around the ears
customer_reviews.text: i find this muffs to be quite comfortable, not only around the ears, but also where they rest on your head. It did take me quite some time to realize how to extend the earpiece to match my ears correctly. Just so you know the muffs do not extend at the head piece, they actually extend down at the earpiece where the metal U-shaped frame at the earpiece meets the frame that goes around your head.
customer_reviews.author: john gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great sound protection.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I bought a set of these muff for myself and my grandson. When I'm not using in ear plugs, these are great. Blocks a high amount of sound while allowing you to have a conversation as well. I also use them when using my chainsaw. Worth the price. Well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: Don’t use indoors with magnums, but otherwise great pair of muffs for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SharePoint Blackbelt

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got these as prizes for my gun range party. The participants loved these. Great quality. Great gift for gun enthusiast. Will purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Misha P Wofford-Young

customer_reviews.title: Are these the best ear muffs you can buy? Absolutely not, but  for the money I don't think these can be beat.
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say I was not expecting a lot from an ear muff that cost $12. I was pleasantly surprised as every once in a while you do get more than what you pay for and these are it. I was upgrading an older pair of ear muffs that I had with these. The old ear muffs had an NRR 26 and this pair has an NRR 34. Although the difference is not drastic there is a noticeable in sound. Are these the best ear muffs you can buy? Absolutely not, but for the money I don't think these can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Walkers EXT Range Shooting Folding Muff lives up to it's claims
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy, inexpensive, functions just as it claimed and muffle. I'd buy another pair . (If I had another set of ears,,,lol!)
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Seem quieter than other similar muffs but mine broke
customer_reviews.text: They do seem quieter than other brands with similar NRR ratings, perhaps in part because they squeeze harder so while they may not be the most comfortable, they may protect your hearing better than loose fitting muffs. Sadly, the plastic piece on the wires that attach to the muff broke. They are too flimsy. I have had the same problem with muffs of similar design, plastic breaks.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Great hearing protection!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my kids to wear while I'm riding our mower, the kids love to ride on it. It provides excellent hearing protection and fits heads as small as a 4 year olds all the way up to me, an adult male with a large noggin. They are tight on me but my kids don't mind them. They do the job for what I wanted and were an excellent price!
customer_reviews.author: D. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Best ever used
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding hearing protection with one of.the highest NRR ratings available. Comfortable and fit me fine but if you have a large head suggest looking for adjustable model but they will cost much more. Highly satisfied with the product but not Amazon that took 5 days before shipping. They didn't wait to take my money. Imagine what they make using customer money for that long on millions of orders!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for college
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I live in an extremely loud college dorm and the only way I can study on a party night (read: every night) is to put these over my earplugs. This was one of the best purchases I've ever made because it lets me sleep or study even when the room next door is having a party. I can rarely hear people though the earplugs and earmuffs.
customer_reviews.author: One Broke College Kid

customer_reviews.title: Great for Shooting or the Races
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for at a very reasonable price. These are awesome for shooting or drag races and very comfortable over the ear muffs. I would highly recommend that other reviewers sold it for me and I want to pass on the good news. The headband is comfortable, noise cancellation makes voices more than 10ft indistinguishable. I bought two pair and my wife agrees these are worthy contenders.
customer_reviews.author: Buster Jones

customer_reviews.title: They work well and are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive ears so I use them around the house when vacuuming, mowing the lawn, or using other noisy tools or appliances. I'm very happy with them and would recommend them to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jim D.

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable or best looking, but okay
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, but they stick out very far from the side of your head and eventually give me a headache. The hearing protection is alright and can be comfortably paired with foam in-ear plugs if you want less noise.
customer_reviews.author: Solumadur

customer_reviews.title: Protect your ears
customer_reviews.text: I used these yesterday on the shooting range, shooting both a 22 and 45 Cal semi-auto hand gun. My son was next to me shooting a 9 mm, using the identical head set. They could not have worked any better. I could hardly hear any of the guns going off. If you want to protect your ears from loud sounds these are the head sets to use. Thick padding and comfortable to wear for an extended period of time. They are rated at a 34 db sound drop.
customer_reviews.author: franks

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these muffs for any noise reduction use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these muffs because they had a very high NRR (34dB) ear protection rating. Wow! Sorry, I have a pair of $1.99 cheapie muffs that are much quieter. I use these when I shoot my hand guns and I'm not sure how they got the 34dB rating. I would not recommend these muffs for any noise reduction use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Walkers EXT ear muffs are excellent for the price. I use them primarily for indoor shooting ranges and they middle my handguns sound very well. Some of the larger caliber rifles still are loud, but not to the point of hearing damage. I highly recommend these. They easily fold up securely and fit in any mid size range bag (I carry two of these in mine)
customer_reviews.author: V. Vergalito

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money lots of noise reduction even when shooting my 300WM at an indoor range.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: A must to protect your ears for work or play
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the best I ever had. Very quiet and sturdy. I like the fact that I can fold them and they become very compact especially when I carry four at a time in a duffel bag or backpack. I use them for the gun range but if I had to run a loud heavy equipment I will not hesitate in wearing them.They appear to be good professional quality and so far no problem.
customer_reviews.author: inspector gadget 007

customer_reviews.title: Better than the electronic kind
customer_reviews.text: Buy this. It is comfortable, fits well, and reduces noise by A LOT!!! I use ear plugs in conjunction to these to better protect my ears. After 2 hours of shooting at the indoor range, I walked out with no ringing in my ears and had immediate hearing clarity when I took my ear protection off. This is unbeatable, especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: StephenTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Great muffs.
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive muffs that fit fine and fold up small. They have higher decibel protection than the others I saw even at higher prices. I bought one, then after satisfied, I bought a second for my wife. We use these for shooting, and they are great. The only complaint is the picture is Green and the muffs are Black both pairs or I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic performance, no matter the price.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic for the price. Comparable headsets go for about three times this much in most retail stores. I wore them out for about 3 hours while shooting and didn't feel any discomfort. I have a large head, so it was a relief that these fit and performed so well. Just a note, the ones that I received were black, which is actually preferred.
customer_reviews.author: thunder2132

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for hearing protection.
customer_reviews.text: I shoot at an indoor range and these Muffs are very good for that. They are the best I've seen for larger caliber pistol or rifle, particularly when one shoots at an indoor range. I bought a second one for a potential guest.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Fit great and sound deadening! Use them while operating a chain saw or wood splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sturdy construction and nicely adjustable. Seats well to the ear, and the padded headband is comfortable for long periods of wear. Ear cups do not squeeze too tightly, and form a very good seal.
customer_reviews.author: NorEaster

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the sale price.
customer_reviews.text: Great all around for the price and being adjustable is a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: peedeekay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic hearing protection at an unbeatable price.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic hearing protection at an unbeatable price. Uncomfortable at first, until the head band is broken in a bit, then very comfortable for up to a couple hours of continuous use. Good for shooting, mowing, pneumatic tools, loud kids. Plenty of space to insert earbuds underneath as well for music while you work or play.
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Q.

customer_reviews.title: Much better than any ear muffs I bought from a home ...
customer_reviews.text: Much better than any ear muffs I bought from a home improvement store. Worn for 2 1/2 hours at the range with glasses and my head and ears were never pinched or sore. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Excellent "muffs" at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bougtht three sets of ear muffs and these Walker "muffs" are the best. Combined with good ear plugs I have no issues with high noise levels.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E Marshall Jr

customer_reviews.title: They work. When I go to the range I ...
customer_reviews.text: They work. When I go to the range I see that they are making their rounds among the shooters there too. Anyone who tries one of these earmuffs and then listens closely enough to hear just how little they cost seems to run to their computer and get some of their own.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect price for a very good product
customer_reviews.text: Not that I've had a lot of experience with over the ear noise reduction product, but I've used these twice and they work great. Standing close to teenage boys as I'm teaching them gun safety while target shooting and have had no problems protecting my hearing. No ringing after several hundreds rounds from various guns. Excellent value for the protection
customer_reviews.author: Tim E 9691

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable -- well as comfy as these things can ever ...
customer_reviews.text: When I teach I use electronic hearing protectors, but when I'm at the range just for myself I use these. They are very comfortable -- well as comfy as these things can ever be. Sound suppression is excellent. My hearing is very sensitive and these really do the job. I have no problem recommending these to my students.
customer_reviews.author: Nwagh73

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Controls the noise
customer_reviews.text: These fit my head. But if you have a large head these would be very tight. Nice product. Controls the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great, no-frills ear muffs. These work great and I didn't have to pay $25 or $30 for some brand name. They block out just the right amount of noise but I can still hear someone talking to me in a normal tone of voice. I would certainly buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: MLM

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as I first thought. I only wear them to sleep in, so I thougt they would last longer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in May and thought they were great until one of the arms disconnected from the muff part and it can't be put back together (6 months use). Not as durable as I first thought. I only wear them to sleep in, so I thought they would last longer.Returns on this item are only good for thirty days, so I guess there is a reason for the affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: mskonasunshine

customer_reviews.title: A little bit of a hum. But for the ...
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a hum. But for the amount I wear them I have not had any issues. They keep the noise out and you can hear background talk which is why I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph J Tognetti Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great ear protection
customer_reviews.text: Great ear protection. I am a firearms enthusiast as well as a music student so I need my hearing intact. I usually shoot in indoor ranges and I trust these to protect my hearing.
customer_reviews.author: RJT

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: A bit too bulky to use comfortably at the range. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Yardy

customer_reviews.title: great for the price, but aren't as soundproof as I expected
customer_reviews.text: These are nice for the price, but you can still hear easily with them on. I got two pairs to start going to an indoor handgun range, but I still wear the soft ear plug inserts underneath these when I go. I think I would be OK without the soft ear plugs, but I recommend using them under these as well just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J

customer_reviews.title: Highest NNR rating for such a low price!
customer_reviews.text: This is uncomfortable just like any other pair of shooting muffs (I changed out the headband), but you just can't beat the price. It has and NNR of 34dB, the only higher ones that I found were 35 and 37 dB, but those cost (at the time) $29.97 and $35.76 respectively. I personally use these over my earbuds (which have active noise canceling), and I can't hear a damn thing!
customer_reviews.author: Lyova

customer_reviews.title: Item broke where the metal bracket contacts the earphones. ...
customer_reviews.text: Item broke where the metal bracket contacts the earphones. Used it 3-5 times total. The last time I went shooting I put it back in my range bag, only to find it broke when I was going through my bag the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Jeskuuuh

customer_reviews.title: I think it could work better.
customer_reviews.text: It does a decent job of blocking out sound at the gun range but I still hear quite a bit of noise from those shooting near me. Sometime it feels as if it is not sitting well over my ears though it is easy to adjust. I will try inner ear protection to see if it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Baker

product_meta.title: Walkers EXT Range Shooting Folding Muff
product_meta.description:
WARNING:
CHOKING HAZARD -- Small parts. Not for children under 3 yrs.
feature_bullets: Ultra-light weight and Compact folding design
Padded headband for comfortable fit with soft PVC Ear Pads
